title: 19. Complexity
description:
MIT 6.006 Introduction to Algorithms, Spring 2020
Instructor: Erik Demaine
View the complete course: https://ocw.mit.edu/6-006S20
YouTube Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLUl4u3cNGP63EdVPNLG3ToM6LaEUuStEY

This lecture discusses computational complexity and introduces terminology: P, NP, EXP, R. These terms are applied to the concepts of hardness and completeness. The lecture ends with discussion on reductions.

tags: decision problem, decidability, nondeterministic polynomial time, NP hard, NP-complete
